docs.title: Platform Capitalism Simulation
docs.text: A research-driven simulation exploring creator wellbeing under different platform governance models

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This simulation environment models creator labor within platform economies using a state-machine framework where agents transition between four archetypal creative states—Optimizer, Hustler, True Believer, and Burnout—based on differential and intermittent reinforcement schedules.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• ✅ CPM-based economics ($2-$40 per 1,000 views)
  • ✅ Volume-based content generation (3-10 posts/day)
  • ✅ Decision tree visualization (agent decision-making transparency)
  • ✅ Multiple governance scenarios (exploitative → cooperative)
  • ✅ Real-time metrics (burnout, addiction, earnings, views)
  • ✅ State machine (4 creator states with probabilistic transitions)
  • ✅ Reward systems (differential, intermittent, hybrid)

docs.title: Research Foundation
docs.text:
Based on empirical research into creator economies, particularly:

Primary Research:

  1. Mears, A. (2025). Learning to Like the Likes and the Hate: The Labor of Internet Fame in the New Attention Economy. Social Problems.

  2. Mears, A. (2023). Bringing Bourdieu to a Content Farm: Social Media Production Fields and the Cultural Economy of Attention. Social Media + Society, 9(3).

Key Insights:

  • CPM-based monetization ($2-$40 per 1,000 views)
  • Content farm economics (median $5K-$30K/month per page)
  • Platform reinforcement strategies (differential vs. intermittent)
  • Creator burnout and addiction patterns
  • Capital conversion dynamics (financial, status, cultural)

docs.title: Agent System
docs.text: The agent system models individual content creators with realistic behaviors, psychological states, and economic outcomes.

docs.title: Agent Architecture
docs.text:
classDiagram
    class Agent {
        +AgentProfile profile
        +List~Dict~ history
        +simulate_content_generation()
        +update_state(rewards, config)
        +get_strategy_info()
        +_evolve_traits()
        +_transition_state()
    }

    class AgentProfile {
        +int id
        +CreatorState current_state
        +str strategy
        +float quality
        +float diversity
        +float consistency
        +float burnout
        +float addiction_drive
        +float resilience
        +float arousal
    }

    class CreatorState {
        <<enumeration>>
        OPTIMIZER
        HUSTLER
        TRUE_BELIEVER
        BURNED_OUT
    }

    Agent --> AgentProfile
    AgentProfile --> CreatorState

docs.title: Core Attributes
docs.text: Attribute Range Description quality 0.0-1.0 Content quality baseline diversity 0.0-1.0 Topic/format variation consistency 0.0-1.0 Posting regularity burnout 0.0-1.0 Exhaustion level addiction_drive 0.0-1.0 Compulsive behavior resilience 0.0-1.0 Recovery ability arousal 0.0-1.0 Platform engagement

docs.title: Strategies
docs.text:
Agents select from 5 content strategies:

  1. Rapid Posting - High volume, lower quality
  2. Strategic Pause - Thoughtful, spaced content
  3. Consistent Quality - Balanced approach
  4. Quality Over Quantity - Premium content focus
  5. Volume Over Quality - Maximum output

docs.title: States
docs.text:
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> OPTIMIZER
    OPTIMIZER --> HUSTLER: High rewards
    OPTIMIZER --> TRUE_BELIEVER: Intrinsic motivation
    HUSTLER --> BURNED_OUT: Burnout > 0.7
    HUSTLER --> OPTIMIZER: Recovery
    BURNED_OUT --> OPTIMIZER: Rest + resilience
    BURNED_OUT --> TRUE_BELIEVER: Find meaning
    TRUE_BELIEVER --> OPTIMIZER: Sustainable
    TRUE_BELIEVER --> HUSTLER: External pressure

docs.title: OPTIMIZER
docs.text:
• Balanced - Sustainable content creation
  • Moderate burnout - 0.3-0.5
  • Strategic - Optimizes for long-term success
  • Transitions: → HUSTLER (high rewards), → TRUE_BELIEVER (intrinsic)

docs.title: HUSTLER
docs.text:
• High output - Maximizing short-term gains
  • Rising burnout - 0.5-0.7
  • Reward-driven - Chases metrics
  • Transitions: → BURNED_OUT (exhaustion), → OPTIMIZER (recovery)

docs.title: BURNED_OUT
docs.text:
• Exhausted - Low output, high stress
  • Critical burnout - > 0.7
  • Recovery mode - Needs rest
  • Transitions: → OPTIMIZER (recovery), → TRUE_BELIEVER (meaning)

docs.title: TRUE_BELIEVER
docs.text:
• Intrinsically motivated - Creates for passion
  • Low burnout - < 0.3
  • Resilient - Less affected by rewards
  • Transitions: → OPTIMIZER (sustainable), → HUSTLER (pressure)

docs.title: Formula
docs.text: posts_per_day = quality × (base_frequency + feedback_modifier) × 10.0

docs.title: Components
docs.text:
1. Base Frequency - Strategy-dependent baseline
  2. Feedback Modifier - Reward-based adjustment
  3. Quality Multiplier - Agent's quality trait
  4. Scaling Factor - 10.0 for realistic volumes

docs.title: Strategy Frequencies
docs.text: Strategy Base Frequency Typical Output Rapid Posting 0.8 6-8 posts/day Strategic Pause 0.3 2-4 posts/day Consistent Quality 0.5 4-6 posts/day Quality Over Quantity 0.4 3-5 posts/day Volume Over Quality 0.9 7-10 posts/day

docs.title: Burnout Accumulation
docs.text:
if posts_generated > threshold:
    burnout += 0.05  # Accumulates with overwork
else:
    burnout -= 0.02  # Recovers with rest

docs.title: Addiction Dynamics
docs.text:
Driven by intermittent reinforcement:

if reward_variance > threshold:
    addiction_drive += 0.03  # Unpredictable rewards

docs.title: Resilience Building
docs.text:
if negative_reward and coping_successful:
    resilience += 0.01  # Grows through adversity

docs.title: History Tracking
docs.text:
Each tick, agents log:

{
    "tick": 5,
    "state": "HUSTLER",
    "posts_generated": 7.5,
    "cpm_earnings": 375.00,
    "burnout": 0.65,
    "addiction_drive": 0.72,
    "resilience": 0.45,
    "quality": 0.80,
    "diversity": 0.60,
    "consistency": 0.75
}

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
# Create agent
profile = AgentProfile(id=1)
profile.strategy = "Quality Over Quantity"
agent = Agent(profile)

# Simulate content generation
posts = agent.simulate_content_generation()
print(f"Generated {posts:.1f} posts")

# Update with rewards
rewards = {
    "final_reward": 0.75,
    "cpm_earnings": 150.00
}
agent.update_state(rewards, policy_config)

# Check state
print(f"State: {agent.profile.current_state.name}")
print(f"Burnout: {agent.profile.burnout:.2f}")

docs.title: 1. Environment (simulation/environment.py)
docs.text:
The central orchestrator that manages:

  • Agent lifecycle - Creation, updates, state management
  • Tick execution - Advances simulation by one time step
  • History tracking - Stores metrics over time
  • Scenario management - Loads and applies policy configurations

Key Methods:

env = Environment(agents=agents)
env.tick()  # Advance one day
env.reset_full_state()  # Reset simulation

docs.title: 2. Policy Engine (simulation/policy_engine/)
docs.text:
Implements platform governance through:

  • Reward calculation - Differential, intermittent, hybrid modes
  • CPM economics - Earnings based on views and quality
  • Policy presets - Exploitative, optimal, balanced, cooperative

Configuration:

config = PolicyConfig(
    mode="differential",
    cpm_rate=10.0,
    avg_views_per_post=5000,
    quality_weight=0.3,
    burnout_penalty=0.4
)

docs.title: 3. Agent System (simulation/agents/)
docs.text:
Individual creator agents with:

  • Profile - ID, strategy, quality, diversity, consistency
  • State machine - OPTIMIZER, HUSTLER, BURNED_OUT, TRUE_BELIEVER
  • Content generation - Dynamic post creation based on strategy
  • History tracking - Posts, earnings, wellbeing metrics

Agent Lifecycle:

agent = Agent(AgentProfile(id=1))
posts = agent.simulate_content_generation()
agent.update_state(rewards, policy_config)

docs.title: 4. UI Layer (ui/)
docs.text:
FastHTML-based interface with:

  • Dashboard - Main simulation view
  • Governance Lab - Policy configuration
  • Agent Cards - Individual creator metrics
  • Decision Trees - Transparency into agent decisions

docs.title: Tick Execution Flow
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    participant UI
    participant Env as Environment
    participant PE as Policy Engine
    participant Agent

    UI->>Env: tick()
    Env->>Agent: simulate_content_generation()
    Agent-->>Env: posts_generated
    Env->>PE: compute_rewards(agents)
    PE-->>Env: rewards dict
    Env->>Agent: update_state(rewards)
    Agent->>Agent: evolve_traits()
    Agent->>Agent: transition_state()
    Agent-->>Env: updated state
    Env->>Env: log_history()
    Env-->>UI: tick complete

docs.title: 1. Separation of Concerns
docs.text:
• Simulation logic independent of UI
  • Policy engine decoupled from agents
  • State management centralized in environment

docs.title: 2. Modularity
docs.text:
• Pluggable policies - Easy to add new governance models
  • Extensible agents - Can add new traits/behaviors
  • Flexible UI - Components can be reused

docs.title: 3. Transparency
docs.text:
• Decision trees - Show agent reasoning
  • Metrics tracking - Full history available
  • Open source - All code visible

docs.title: 4. Research-First
docs.text:
• Empirically grounded - Based on real research
  • Reproducible - Deterministic when needed
  • Extensible - Easy to add new experiments

docs.title: In-Memory State
docs.text:
• No database - Fast, simple
  • State resets - Clean slate each session
  • History limits - Prevent memory bloat

docs.title: Optimization
docs.text:
• Lazy evaluation - Only compute when needed
  • Efficient updates - Minimal re-renders
  • Caching - Reuse computed values
